Brian McGrory was surprised to hear from a reader about a good Samaritan at the MBTA — the agency of fare hikes and late trains — but it turned out to be true.

For father, 13-year fight finally ends

Since his daughter Melissa’s murder in 1999, Leo Gosule has pushed for a proposal that would bar parole for certain ­repeat felons. Tuesday, he learned that “Melissa’s Bill” will become law.

Gore Vidal, celebrated author, dies

Gore Vidal, the author, playwright, politician and commentator whose novels, essays, plays and opinions were stamped by his immodest wit and unconventional wisdom, died Tuesday.

Politics

Texas' Cruz gets easy victory

Ted Cruz pulled off what had seemed an unthinkable upset Tuesday, and it wasn't even close. He trounced his opponent, long-time Texas lieutenant governor David Dewhurst, to win the GOP nomination for the US Senate.

Barnes & Noble, independent stores unite on antitrust case

Longtime rivals Barnes & Noble Inc. and the country’s independent booksellers have united in New York to support publishers being sued by the government over antitrust claims.
